awd_titl_txt: REU:  Resolving Patterns of Vegetation Change in Central    New England:  A Geographical Approach
awd_abstract_narration: The P.I.'s will analyze historical changes and interactions                between land-use practices and forest vegetation in central New                 England.  An area that encompasses significant gradients in                     environmental factors and cultural activity.  Specific objectives               include: (1) examination of differences in the rate and degree of               forest clearance and farm abandonment across the region, (2)                    determination of the relative contribution of economic forces                   versus physical constraints on these processes, and (3)                         investigation of the effect of land-use history on the current                  structure of the modern vegetation.  Data will include numerous                 historical sources collected on a township basis and spatial                    analysis will utilize geographic information system.  The results               of the research will provide information on long-term changes in                the environment,  and how these are mediated by human activities.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: PRESIDENT AND FELLOWS OF HARVARD COLLEGE
